wlcsim Python Module¶

WLCSIM: A Python interface to the Spakowitz lab’s Worm Like Chain SIMulator

wlcsim.data¶

This module “understands” wlcsim.exe’s output, and will make it into nice, pretty numpy/pandas arrays for you.

class wlcsim.data.Scan(run_path, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Can tell you what dirs in a run_dir are simulation directories, and what all the input files said, and more.

class wlcsim.data.Sim(sim_path, overwrite_coltimes=False, load_method=3)[source]¶

Sim provides an interface to the heterogenous data produced by a simulation that saves coltimes, positions, and momentums.

Unless specified during initialization, the coltimes, r, and u are loaded on demand upon first access.

Accessing properties of this class for the first time can return an IOError if a file is moved, or doesn’t exist. Afterwards, the values will be cached.

_coltimes[source]¶

Keep the original matrix around for convenience.

static df_from_coltimes(coltimes, method=3)[source]¶

Make a DataFrame with the two colliding beads’ indices in the polymer and the first collision time between them as columns.

did_fill_coltimes()[source]¶

True if the simulation ran long enough that every bead collided with every other bead. Otherwise False.

r[source]¶

Numpy array of positions of each particle at each time point.

r0[source]¶

Numpy array of positions of each particle at each time point.

u[source]¶

Numpy array of positions of each particle at each time point.

u0[source]¶

Numpy array of positions of each particle at each time point.

wlcsim.data.add_useful_cols_to_coltimes(coltimes)[source]¶

Only works on coltimes that come from combine_coltimes_csvs.

wlcsim.data.add_useful_cols_to_sim_info(sim_info, run_path)[source]¶

Centralized place to call functions that add columns to the DataFrame holding information about each simulation that has been run.

wlcsim.data.combine_initial_dists_csvs(run_path, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Not yet implemented.

wlcsim.data.insert_simulations(run_path, mode='x', file_name=run_path/../'all_simulations.csv')[source]¶

makes each run that was done in a particular run directory into a row in a pandas DataFrame holding all of the parameters of that run. mode=None triggers that DataFrame to be returned, and no file read or written. mode=’r’ triggers file_name to be read and the contents appended to the generated DataFrame before it’s returned. mode=’w’ triggers the new DataFrame to overwrite the file file_name in run_path/.. mode=’a’ triggers the new DataFrame to be appended to the file file_name in run_path/..

Only mode=’a’ is implemented for now, as that’s the only one I need for my meeting with Andy tomorrow.

wlcsim.data.nan_fill_coltimes(coltimes)[source]¶

Takes a raw coltimes pandas array from e.g. write_coltimes_csvs and puts nan’s where the -1.0’s are, i.e. where the simulation did not go out far enough.

wlcsim.data.pairwise_distances3[source]¶

Returns np.array of pairwise distances of points in R^3 stored in a 3-by-num_points numpy array.

wlcsim.input¶

This module “understands” the input format of wlcsim.exe

wlcsim.input.read_file(input_file)[source]¶

returns a list: ordered_param_names, and a dict: simulation_params

wlcsim.input.write_file(input_file, ordered_param_names, params)[source]¶

writes out a valid input file for wlcsim.exe given parameters in the format returned by read_file

wlcsim.analyze¶

Currently, dumping place for all analysis routines.

class wlcsim.analyze.MapMeanColtimes(group_params)[source]¶

Function object, allows the same-named method to be passed to Pool.map

wlcsim.analyze.map_cdf_coltimes(sim_dir, dt, group_params=['linear_distance'])[source]¶

TODO: actually implement

wlcsim.analyze.striding_map_mean_coltimes(sim_dir, idx_gap=0, group_params=['linear_distance'])[source]¶

Not yet implemented. In the future, this should calculate the mean for a particular simulation of all the beads of each separation possible, without overlapping looped sections. Gah. Don’t feel like typing that better.
